availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Kendall (Morgan County, lawyer and soldier)

body.p: Morgan County, Kentucky, lawyer and soldier. Morgan County native. Married to Martha A. Davidson in 1860. Father of Joseph M. Kendall, John Rebel Kendall, and Lula May Kendall. Lawyer in Morgan County in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) from 1861 to 1862. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) from November 25, 1862 to 1865.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, District 1, p. 109. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, West Liberty, p. 1. Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 55 and 110. H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 720-721. United States Congress, Memorial Addresses on the Life and Character of John W. Kendall, a Representative from Kentucky: Delivered in the House of Representatives and in the Senate (Washington: Government Printing Office, 1893). Find A Grave, "John Wilkerson Kendall 1834-1892," Memorial #20813614, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/20813614# (accessed on July 19, 2018).
